page.title: 03HISTORIC BUILDINGS-BEDWORTH
page.content: {Newland Hall Farm}built in 1211, rebuilt in 1580.Many of the rooms have oak beams and a bedroom has James 1st oak panels.The brook at the bottom of the garden has been straightened & a mill used to be there;the farmer found a large millstone.The farm used to be a monastery & on the outside wall are some carved faces called gargoyles. They are carved on cobels which are blocks of stone that hold oak beams in place.{The Old Vicarage}in Vicarage Lane is about 400 yrs old;half of the original is still there.It was 2 Elizabethen cottages.The front door is from a pub in Bishop Street,Coventry. The rooms have exposed oak beams & one has a large brick fireplace.Oliver Cromwell's signature is written backwards on an upstairs window.There is also an old coach-house & stone "stool" for mounting horses.
